symbols



class SYMBOLS;
Holds all the global symbols. Symbols are obtained from any json files passed in. The json files are created with the dmd -X option. So for any package you want the symbols for just create a json file for it and do SYMBOLS.Load(pkg.json). Project tag files will automatically be passed in.

void Engage();
Engage symbols (ie get it ready to run)

void Disengage();
Disengage symbols (ie clean up / save or whatever )

void AddCommonTagFile(string key, string TagFile);
Adds a 'TagFile' (dmd -X json file) to the configurtion file.

If user opts for auto symbol loading this file of symbols will be automatically loaded at start up.

Does not actually load anything. Have to run Load or Reconfigure or wait for a restart. Nor does it check that TagFile exists or key is already in use.

Params:
string key name of package, used as associative key.
string TagFile json file with symbols.

void Load(string key, string symfile);
Loads a 'TagFile'

Params:
string key the name of the package of symbols also used as associative array key
string symfile actual json file to be loaded

DSYMBOL LoadConcurrent(string key, string symfile);
Load modified to return a DSYMBOL so it can be used in a parallel foreach (see std.parallel) Actually slowed symbol loading down significantly.

DSYMBOL[] PossibleMatches(string Candidate);
DSYMBOL[] GetMembers(string Base, DSYMBOL[] HayStack = null);
Dont think this function is even used +1 for code coverage

DSYMBOL[] MatchCallTips(string Candidate);
Given a Candidate (aaa.bbb.llll()) return all matching function symbols

DSYMBOL[] Match(string Candidate);
Returns possibles completions of Candidate (ie matches)

Params:
string Candidate partial symbol to match, can be a symbol path (std.algorithm.sort)

DSYMBOL[] ExactMatches(string Candidate);
Returns any symbol that is an "exact" match for candidate name. Multible symbol returns are possible if different packages or objects have members with identical names.

Params:
string Candidate full symbol to match, can be a symbol path (std.algorithm.sort)

string StringPath(string Candidate);
Gets the 'path' of Candidate removing any whitespace around the "." seperator which maybe introduced for fomatting ...

Examples:
 string c = "myAClassObject	.Buffer		.flush();";
 string d = "yourAClassObject	.Buffer		.flush();";

 string e = StringPath(c);
 string f = StringPath(d);

 assert(e == "myAClassObject.Buffer");
 assert(f == "yourAClassObject.Buffer");


Params:
string Candidate symbol name possibly including scope/path(aa.bb.name)

Returns:
The scope/path part of candidate sans whitespace possibly ""

string[] GetCandidatePath(string Candidate);
Similiar to StringPath but

Params:
string Candidate optional/partial scope/path plus name of symbol.

Returns:
an array of strings for the scope/path of candidate

string GetCandidateName(string Candidate);
Filters out the scope/path of Candidate.

Returns:
The name of Candidate (or partial name)

void TriggerSignal(DSYMBOL[] SymbolsToPass);
Allows an outside source (ie element) to cause a forward signal to be emitted
